cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 85 mi SSW of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Slowly moving west-northwest, then turning northwest and north toward the central-southeastern Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Morgan City, Louisiana (central LA coast)
cyclone.hours_to_offshore: N/A – storm moves inland, not offshore again near Beaumont

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Mouth of the Mississippi River to Grand Isle and Intracoastal City to Cameron, LA.  Tropical Storm Watch: East of Pearl River to the MS/AL border.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: Intracoastal City to Grand Isle, LA.  Tropical Storm Warning: Mouth of Pearl River to Grand Isle, Lake Pontchartrain & Maurepas, Intracoastal City to Cameron, LA.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast from upper Texas coast eastward to the Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Low to moderate chance (25%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds (≥34 kt) with gusts to 40–45 mph late Saturday into Sunday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant surge expected along the upper Texas coast near Beaumont.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands on the western flank of Barry could bring 2–6 inches of rain with isolated 4+ inches, producing localized flooding of low-lying areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in outer rainbands cannot be ruled out, though the risk is low this far west of the center.
